name: I Killed the Prom Queen
description:
'''I Killed the Prom Queen''' is an Australian [[metalcore]] band from [[Adelaide]], formed in 2001. They were prominent in the Australian live music scene and toured the US, Japan and Europe several times. They issued three studio albums: ''[[When Goodbye Means Forever...]]'' (2003), ''[[Music for the Recently Deceased]]'' (2006) and ''[[Beloved (I Killed the Prom Queen album)|Beloved]]'' (2014). The latter two albums peaked at #27 and #6 on the [[ARIA Charts|ARIA Albums Chart]] respectively.

The band initially split up in April 2007 due to the inability to find a permanent vocalist. They reformed with vocalist [[Michael Crafter]] to play a farewell tour in mid-2008 and released a live album and [[DVD]], ''[[Sleepless Nights and City Lights]]'', which peaked at #48 in Australia. In May 2011 the band reformed with new vocalist Jamie Hope and performed on the Destroy Music Tour. They subsequently released their third studio album ''[[Beloved (I Killed the Prom Queen album)|Beloved]]'' in February 2014.
